sale_service.models module

class sale_service.models.Sale(inventory_id, customer_id, quantity, price)[source]

Bases: Model

The Sale object represents a sale transaction in the system.

Parameters:

  • inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item sold

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer who purchased the item

  • quantity (int) – The quantity of the item sold

  • price (float) – The price of the item at the time of sale

Variables:

  • sale_id (int) – The unique identifier for the sale

  • inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item sold

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer who purchased the item

  • date (str) – The date when the sale occurred

  • quantity (int) – The quantity of the item sold

  • price (float) – The price of the item at the time of sale

class sale_service.models.SaleSchema(*, only: types.StrSequenceOrSet | None = None, exclude: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), many: bool = False, context: dict | None = None, load_only: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), dump_only: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), partial: bool | types.StrSequenceOrSet | None = None, unknown: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: Schema

The SaleSchema object is used for serializing and deserializing sale data.

Variables:

  • Meta.fields (tuple) – The fields included in the schema (‘sale_id’, ‘inventory_id’, ‘customer_id’, ‘quantity’, ‘price’, ‘date’)

  • Meta.model (Sale) – The associated model for the schema (Sale)

sale_service.sale module

sale_service.sale.get_good(id)[source]

Retrieve details of a specific good by its ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the good to retrieve

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 404 if the good is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the good details

Return type:

flask.Response

sale_service.sale.get_goods()[source]

Retrieve a list of goods.

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of available goods with their names and prices

Return type:

flask.Response

sale_service.sale.make_sale()[source]

Make a sale for a specific good.

Parameters:

good_name (str) – The name of the good to be sold

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 403 for unauthorized access, 404 if the good or customer is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the sale details

Return type:

flask.Response
